attributes.action: Prevent Young's Brewery form closing one of Londons Great Live Music venues
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
One of Londons favourite live music venues is facing closure: the Halfmoon in Putney,may have to call time on almost 50 years of hosting live music.
Due to market forces, the current economic climate and other circumstances
beyond their control, The Halfmoon will not be able to carry on as a music venue after 31st January 2010.
The Halfmoon has been hosting live music regularly since 1963. Since that time it has seen performances by, among others, The Rolling Stones, U2, The SmallFaces, Ralph McTell, Elvis Costello, Kate Bush and countless more.
As well as still catering for touring bands and artists !The Halfmoon is an engine room for rising bands throughout the UK, who are 
now running out of quality venues to play."
Without the right measures being taken The Halfmoon could easily join a
growing list of music venues that have closed in recent months/years. It would
be another blow to music and culture in London if The Halfmoon disappears as well.
You can help save The Halfmoon. Please vote with your feet and come for a 
drink, or come to one of our nightly live music shows.

reasons: Commercial endorsement, promotion of any product, service or publication, or statements that amount to adverts
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
